attributes.action: join the EU Commission in condemnation of religious backing for political parties in Turkey before the Balkans once more spirals out of control
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
AOL today reports,

"The European Commission in Brussels has blasted legal manoeuvring in Turkey to ban the country's ruling Islamic-rooted party .... 

In response to the top court's voting unanimously to hear a motion to ban Turkey's Islamic-rooted ruling party -  the petitioner is calling on the P.M. to use his diplomatic influence to assert peace in this region - because it has the potential to again be what post World War One politicians described as a "cauldron". Peacemakers then, as you should, recognsied it's potential for religious, political, international border and ethnic strife.

We the undersigned agree with EU officials - which Turkey hopes to join some day - that "the kind of political issues referred to in this case (should be) debated in the parliament and decided through the ballot box, not in courtrooms".
